alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior; Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Northern Humboldt Interior; Northern Lake County; Northern Trinity; Northwestern Mendocino Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior; Southern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 15 at 6:58PM PST until December 15 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...AREAS OF HEAVY SNOW TO CONTINUE THROUGH EARLY EVENING... Snow levels will gradually rise overnight and range from 2500 to 3500 feet. Heaviest snow continues across portions of Trinity County where an additional 3 to 5 inches is possible through this evening. Greater amounts are likely above 3500 feet. Precipitation rates have tapered off this evening, although scattered rain and snow showers are likely through the night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Areas of heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up 3 to 5 inches are possible above 2000 feet...with greater accumulations above 3000 feet. Precipitation rates are expected to taper off before midnight but scattered rain and snow showers will likely continue overnight. * WHERE...Southern Trinity and Northern Trinity Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible along higher passes of highways 3, 36 and 299.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
